snippet: As the tussle over filling seats in China’s supreme ruling body enters its final days, reformists are looking to Wang Yang, a party boss who has promoted individual happiness.
abstract: Chinese reformists are anxious for Guangdong Province's top official Wang Yang to win coveted spot in central leadership; Wang Yang remains reformist camp's best candidate for counterbalancing slate of colorless technocrats and conservatives who are likely to dominate all powerful Politburo Standing Committee that runs country (Series: Changing of the Guard).
lead_paragraph: As the tussle over filling seats in China’s supreme ruling body enters its final days, reformists are looking to Wang Yang, a party boss who has promoted individual happiness.

headline.print_headline: As China Awaits New Leadership, Liberals Look to a Provincial Party Chief
headline.seo: Liberals in China Look to Guangdong’s Party Chief, Wang Yang
headline.main: As China Awaits New Leadership, Liberals Look to a Provincial Party Chief

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
